title: Ticket #6629: condor_annex fails when uploading config files to us-east-2
description:
Heath Skarlupka reports from IceCube: 

condor_annex -aws-spot-fleet -slots 1 \
    -aws-spot-fleet-config-file /home/annex/spot_fleet_configs/us-east-2.json \
    -config-dir /home/annex/condor_configs -annex-name ohio -duration 1 -no-owner \
    -aws-ec2-url https://ec2.us-east-2.amazonaws.com \
    -aws-events-url https://events.us-east-2.amazonaws.com \
    -aws-lambda-url https://lambda.us-east-2.amazonaws.com \
    -aws-s3-url https://s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com
...
Upload failed: 'E_HTTP_RESPONSE_NOT_200 (400)' (1): '<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>\n<Error>
AuthorizationHeaderMalformed<Message>The authorization header is malformed; the region
'us-east-1' is wrong; expecting 'us-east-2'</Message>
<Region>us-east-2</Region><RequestId>3C44D45A17C4119F</RequestId><HostId>wgvQ3M4Wl4fDq7ci1zNQK2734JuF5eF7NlJ2Krday9ySIDnrLliyIxmixxDr6euSYHQ+0mPoARc=</HostId></Error>'.

The problem is that the 'region' value (used only by the security code) is wrongly always set to 'us-east-1' for S3 uploads.
remarks:
2018-Mar-28 17:52:49 by tlmiller:
Additionally, it's silly to make Heath specify all those URLs on the command line. Either (or both):

  • store the URLs specified on the -setup command line in the config file
  • add a command-line switch to specify the region (that sets all those URLs)

2018-Mar-28 18:09:51 by tlmiller:
The patch works, but doesn't fully solve the problem: 'aws s3 cp s3url://... .' no longer works for region-specific buckets. It will work if you supply the '--region <name>' flag, but now we have a different bootstrapping problem to solve....

Maybe the issue that required region-specific buckets has been solved? Could try that, instead, maybe....

2018-Mar-30 10:50:06 by tlmiller:
49ec2-config.sh already knows what region it's in, so that's not a boot-strapping problem. And since the whole issue is that the bucket is region-specific, we can safely assume that the region the instance launched in is the region whose S3 bucket we specified.
